newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toho Life to raise Y10 bln to bolster capital base.
newsitem.headline: Toho Life to raise Y10 bln to bolster capital base.

text.p: Toho Mutual Life Insurance Co said on Friday it would raise a total of 10 billion yen from other financial institutions to boost its capital base to 11 billion yen from one billion yen at present.
A spokesman for the Japanese life insurer told Reuters the fund-raising plan was expected to be approved at a company meeting on July 2.
He gave no details as to how the capital would be raised.
He declined to comment on whether the company planned to sell its headquarters to raise funds, stating only, "We haven't sold it yet."

Rating agency Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday it had assigned a Bpi rating to Toho Life and other second-tier Japanese life insurers. It said this rating indicated vulnerability in an insurer's financial security.
